definition: (of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture

sentences.english: Speaking French and playing the piano are social graces.
sentences.chinese: 讲法语和弹钢琴是社交界的两大风雅。

sentences.english: He would certainly have done more justice to simple and elegant prose.
sentences.chinese: 他一定善于朗读质朴风雅的散文。

sentences.english: Sure. I love this place, especially the decoration. So tasteful!
sentences.chinese: 当然，我很喜欢这个地方，尤其是它的布置，很风雅。
他是一位风雅的艺术家。

sentences.english: And I know I may be an artsy person in sb′s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我知道可能在别人眼里我是个附庸风雅的的人。

sentences.english: The whole arty get-up seemed oddly at variance with the way she behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她那套附庸风雅的穿戴似乎跟她的举止格格不入。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-farty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的电影都是附庸风雅的并且大部分都很长。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-arty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的电影都是附庸风雅的并且大部分都很长。

sentences.english: About the Court, such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon.
sentences.chinese: 在显宦贵族们当中，这类风雅好客的事不足为奇。

sentences.english: I wasn't interested in a snob degree.
sentences.chinese: 我对人家附庸风雅的地位没有兴趣。

sentences.english: Moslin, a fine and artistic type of cloth was well-known worldwide.
sentences.chinese: Moslin是全世界有名的精致而风雅的布料。

sentences.english: They run a little pottery shop and cafe and are very arty -crafty.
sentences.chinese: 他们开了一家小陶器店兼咖啡馆，很喜欢附庸风雅。

sentences.english: Cocktails are once again recognized by modern sophisticates as being the tipple of the suave.
sentences.chinese: 现代风雅之士再次将鸡尾酒视为“柔和的烈酒”。

sentences.english: With his usual elegance, he goes right to the core of the issue.
sentences.chinese: 用他一贯的风雅的言词，他正确地抓住了问题的核心。

sentences.english: The large cities are of course do not have a monopolise on architectural or historical monuments.
sentences.chinese: 当然大城市并不占尽建筑风采或名胜古迹之风雅。

sentences.english: May:Sure. I love this place, especially the decoration. So tasteful!
sentences.chinese: 当然，我很喜欢这个地方，尤其是它的布置，很风雅。

definition: (of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
poetry and pictorial art/work of art combining pictures and poetry
